trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

trait.name: Kor Climbing
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Athletics and Acrobatics skills.

trait.name: Lucky
trait.text: When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Brave
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, and communicate in the silent speech of the kor.

trait.name: Speed
trait.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You also have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Accustomed to the night, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Wind Creed Manipulation
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Deception and Persuasion skills.

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the druid spell list. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Merfolk, and one extra language of your choice

trait.name: Speed
trait.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You also have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Accustomed to the night, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Water Creed Navigation
trait.text: You have proficiency with navigator's tools and in the Survival skill.

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Merfolk, and one extra language of your choice

trait.name: Speed
trait.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet. You also have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1

trait.name: Amphibious
trait.text: Accustomed to the night, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Creed of the Trickster
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Sleight of Hand and Stealth skills.

trait.name: Cantrip
trait.text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the bard spell list. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Merfolk, and one extra language of your choice

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence and Charisma scores each increase by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Thanks to your heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Vampiric Resistance
trait.text: You have resistance to necrotic damage.

trait.name: Blood Thirst
trait.text: You can drain blood and life energy from a willing creature, or one that is grappled by you, incapacitated, or restrained. Make a melee attack against the target. If you hit, you deal 1 piercing damage and 1d6 necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and you regain hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid killed in this way becomes a null (see "A Zendikar Bestiary").

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Vampire.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence and Charisma scores each increase by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Grit
trait.text: You have resistance to fire damage and psychic damage. In addition, when you are wearing no armor, your AC is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Grotag Tamer
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Animal Handling skill.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence and Charisma scores each increase by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Grit
trait.text: You have resistance to fire damage and psychic damage. In addition, when you are wearing no armor, your AC is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Lavastep Grit
trait.text: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky or subterranean environments.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Intelligence and Charisma scores each increase by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to life underground, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Grit
trait.text: You have resistance to fire damage and psychic damage. In addition, when you are wearing no armor, your AC is equal to 11 + your Dexterity modifier.

trait.name: Tuktuk Cunning
trait.text: You have proficiency with thieves' tools.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Goblin.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2. Your Charisma score increases by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trait.name: Skill Versatility
trait.text: You gain proficiency in any combination of two skills or tools of your choice.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2. Your Dexterity score increases by 1.

trait.name: Darkvision
trait.text: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trait.name: Elf Weapon Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

trait.name: Fleet of Foot
trait.text: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

trait.name: Mask of the Wild
trait.text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.

trait.name: Ability Score Increase
trait.text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2.

trait.name: Superior Darkvision
trait.text: Your darkvision has a radius of 120 feet.

Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

trait.name: Keen Senses
trait.text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
trait.text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
trait.text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

trait.name: Mul Daya Magic
trait.text: You know the chill touch cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the hex spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When you reach 5th level, you can cast the darkness spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

trait.name: Elf Weapon Training
trait.text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

trait.name: Languages
trait.text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish. Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.
